title: How to Remove Copper Stains from Baths and Showers

steps.headline: Make up a paste.
steps.description: Use equal quantities of cream of tartar and baking soda (bicarbonate of soda). Add a little water to mix into a smooth paste.

steps.headline: Spread the paste across the blue-green stain.
Leave the paste to work on the stain.
steps.description: About half an hour should be sufficient time for it to do its cleaning job.

steps.headline: Rinse off the paste.
steps.description: Check the stain to see how much has been removed. Repeat if needed.

tyn: Rinsing cloth, or just splash water on the paste to remove
